tasks.title: Task 1: Documentation Infrastructure Setup
tasks.description: Set up infrastructure for package documentation: create README template, update Cargo.toml repository links, remove Doxidize, add rustdoc integration, and update main README.
tasks.details: This task establishes the foundation for all package documentation. It includes creating a README template structure, updating all Cargo.toml files with package-specific repository links pointing to subdirectories, removing Doxidize configuration, adding rustdoc include_str! integration pattern, and updating the main README to link to package READMEs instead of containing all content.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify: repository links work correctly, rustdoc includes README content, main README links are valid, no Doxidize references remain.

subtasks.title: Create README Template Structure
subtasks.description: Create a standardized README template that includes: package description, quick start example, key features, API overview, links to docs.rs, usage examples, dependencies and features. Template should be adaptable for different package types (core, producer, consumer, transformer, integration).

subtasks.title: Update All Cargo.toml Repository Links

tasks.title: Task 12: Zero-Copy Architecture Implementation - Phase 1: Binary Data Zero-Copy
tasks.description: Implement Phase 1 of zero-copy architecture: replace Vec<u8> with Bytes in serialization, update channel types, and modify graph execution code to use zero-copy binary data handling.
tasks.details: Phase 1 establishes the foundation for zero-copy operations by replacing Vec<u8> with bytes::Bytes throughout the serialization and channel infrastructure. This eliminates memory copies for binary data in graph execution, achieving 80-95% memory reduction for binary data. All implementation tasks focus on code changes only - no testing or validation tasks.

subtasks.title: Add bytes Dependency to Workspace
subtasks.description: Add bytes crate dependency to workspace Cargo.toml with serde feature enabled for compatibility. Update workspace.dependencies section to include bytes = { version = "1.x", features = ["serde"] }.

subtasks.title: Update Root Cargo.toml Workspace Dependencies
subtasks.description: Add bytes dependency to [workspace.dependencies] section in root Cargo.toml with version "1.x" and features = ["serde"].

subtasks.title: Add bytes Dependency to graph Package
subtasks.description: Add bytes dependency to packages/graph/Cargo.toml, referencing workspace dependency. Ensure serde feature is enabled.

subtasks.title: Replace Vec<u8> with Bytes in Serialization Module
subtasks.description: Update packages/graph/src/serialization.rs to use bytes::Bytes instead of Vec<u8> for all serialization functions. Replace serialize function return type from Vec<u8> to Bytes, update deserialize function to accept Bytes, and ensure all internal serialization code uses Bytes.

subtasks.title: Update serialize Function Signature
subtasks.description: Change serialize function in packages/graph/src/serialization.rs to return Result<Bytes, SerializationError> instead of Result<Vec<u8>, SerializationError>. Update function body to convert Vec<u8> from serde_json::to_vec to Bytes::from(vec).

subtasks.title: Update deserialize Function to Accept Bytes
subtasks.description: Change deserialize function in packages/graph/src/serialization.rs to accept Bytes instead of &[u8]. Update function body to use bytes.as_ref() for zero-copy access to underlying slice. Maintain backward compatibility if needed.

subtasks.title: Update All Serialization Error Types
subtasks.description: Review and update any error types in serialization.rs that reference Vec<u8> to use Bytes instead. Ensure error messages and error context are updated appropriately.

subtasks.title: Add Bytes Import Statements
subtasks.description: Add use bytes::Bytes; import to packages/graph/src/serialization.rs. Ensure all necessary Bytes-related imports are present.

subtasks.title: Update Channel Types to Use Bytes
subtasks.description: Update all channel type definitions in packages/graph/src/node.rs to use Bytes instead of Vec<u8>. This includes input_channels and output_channels HashMap types, and all channel send/receive operations.

subtasks.title: Update ProducerNode Channel Types
subtasks.description: Change output_channels parameter type in ProducerNode::spawn_execution_task from HashMap<usize, mpsc::Sender<Vec<u8>>> to HashMap<usize, mpsc::Sender<Bytes>>. Update all channel operations to use Bytes.

subtasks.title: Update TransformerNode Channel Types
subtasks.description: Change input_channels and output_channels parameter types in TransformerNode::spawn_execution_task from HashMap<usize, mpsc::Receiver/Sender<Vec<u8>>> to HashMap<usize, mpsc::Receiver/Sender<Bytes>>. Update all channel operations.

subtasks.title: Update ConsumerNode Channel Types
subtasks.description: Change input_channels parameter type in ConsumerNode::spawn_execution_task from HashMap<usize, mpsc::Receiver<Vec<u8>>> to HashMap<usize, mpsc::Receiver<Bytes>>. Update all channel operations.

subtasks.title: Update StreamWrapper Channel Operations
subtasks.description: Update StreamWrapper::from_receiver and StreamWrapper::from_multiple_receivers methods in packages/graph/src/node.rs to accept mpsc::Receiver<Bytes> instead of mpsc::Receiver<Vec<u8>>. Update deserialization calls to use Bytes::as_ref().

subtasks.title: Update Graph Execution Code
subtasks.description: Update all graph execution code in packages/graph/src/node.rs to work with Bytes instead of Vec<u8>. This includes updating serialization calls, channel send/receive operations, and any code that manipulates serialized data.

subtasks.title: Update ProducerNode Execution Task
subtasks.description: Update ProducerNode::spawn_execution_task implementation to use Bytes for serialization. Change serialize call to return Bytes, update channel.send to use Bytes, and ensure all serialized data uses Bytes throughout the execution flow.

subtasks.title: Update TransformerNode Execution Task
subtasks.description: Update TransformerNode::spawn_execution_task implementation to use Bytes for all serialization operations. Update input channel receive operations to handle Bytes, update output channel send operations to use Bytes, and ensure StreamWrapper integration works with Bytes.

subtasks.title: Update ConsumerNode Execution Task
subtasks.description: Update ConsumerNode::spawn_execution_task implementation to use Bytes for input channel receive operations. Update StreamWrapper integration to handle Bytes, and ensure deserialization works with Bytes::as_ref().

subtasks.title: Update Graph Execution Module
subtasks.description: Review packages/graph/src/execution.rs (if exists) and update any execution-related code to use Bytes instead of Vec<u8>. Update any helper functions, error types, or execution context structures that reference Vec<u8>.

subtasks.title: Update Error Handling for Bytes
subtasks.description: Review and update all error handling code in graph execution that references Vec<u8> serialization errors. Update error messages and error context to reflect Bytes usage. Ensure SerializationError types work correctly with Bytes.

subtasks.title: Add Backward Compatibility Layer
subtasks.description: Add deprecated wrapper functions that maintain backward compatibility with Vec<u8> APIs. This allows gradual migration and prevents breaking changes for existing code.

subtasks.title: Add Deprecated serialize_to_vec Function
subtasks.description: Add a deprecated serialize_to_vec function in packages/graph/src/serialization.rs that returns Vec<u8>. This function should internally call serialize and convert Bytes to Vec<u8>. Add #[deprecated] attribute with migration message.

subtasks.title: Add Deprecated deserialize_from_slice Function
subtasks.description: Add a deprecated deserialize_from_slice function that accepts &[u8] and internally converts to Bytes before calling deserialize. Add #[deprecated] attribute with migration message pointing to new Bytes API.

subtasks.title: Update Documentation with Migration Notes
subtasks.description: Add documentation comments to deprecated functions explaining the migration path. Include examples showing how to migrate from Vec<u8> to Bytes APIs.

tasks.title: Task 13: Zero-Copy Architecture Implementation - Phase 2: Shared Ownership for Fan-Out
tasks.description: Implement Phase 2 of zero-copy architecture: add ZeroCopyShare trait, implement smart fan-out routing with Arc, and update message types to support shared ownership for zero-copy fan-out scenarios.
tasks.details: Phase 2 implements shared ownership patterns using Arc for fan-out scenarios where one item is sent to multiple consumers. This eliminates memory copies in fan-out operations, achieving 60-90% memory reduction. Implementation focuses on trait design, routing logic, and message type updates.

subtasks.title: Implement ZeroCopyShare Trait
subtasks.description: Create ZeroCopyShare trait in packages/graph/src/zero_copy.rs (new file) that defines interface for zero-copy sharing. Implement trait with associated type Shared, to_shared method, and from_shared method. Add blanket implementation for Send + Sync + 'static types.

subtasks.title: Create zero_copy Module File
subtasks.description: Create new file packages/graph/src/zero_copy.rs and add mod zero_copy; declaration to packages/graph/src/lib.rs. Add necessary imports including std::sync::Arc.

subtasks.title: Define ZeroCopyShare Trait
subtasks.description: Define ZeroCopyShare trait with associated type Shared: Clone + Send + Sync, to_shared method that returns Self::Shared, and from_shared method that takes Self::Shared and returns Self. Add Send + Sync + 'static bounds to trait.

subtasks.title: Implement Blanket Implementation for Send + Sync Types
subtasks.description: Add blanket implementation of ZeroCopyShare for all T where T: Send + Sync + 'static. Set type Shared = Arc<T>, implement to_shared to return Arc::new(self), and implement from_shared to use Arc::try_unwrap with clone fallback.

subtasks.title: Add ZeroCopyShareWeak Trait
subtasks.description: Define ZeroCopyShareWeak trait that extends ZeroCopyShare with Weak reference support. Add associated type Weak: Send + Sync, downgrade method, and upgrade method. This enables more efficient memory management in some scenarios.

subtasks.title: Export ZeroCopyShare from graph Module
subtasks.description: Add pub use zero_copy::ZeroCopyShare; and pub use zero_copy::ZeroCopyShareWeak; to packages/graph/src/lib.rs to export the traits from the graph package.

subtasks.title: Implement Smart Fan-Out Routing with Arc
subtasks.description: Update graph execution code to detect fan-out scenarios and use Arc for zero-copy sharing. Implement logic to check output_channels length and use Arc::new + Arc::clone for multiple outputs, or direct move for single output.

subtasks.title: Add Fan-Out Detection Logic to ProducerNode
subtasks.description: Update ProducerNode::spawn_execution_task to detect when output_channels.len() > 1. For fan-out scenarios, wrap item in Arc::new before sending, and use Arc::clone for each channel send. For single output, use direct move.

subtasks.title: Update ProducerNode Channel Types for Arc
subtasks.description: Change output_channels type in ProducerNode::spawn_execution_task to accept Arc<P::Output> where P::Output: Send + Sync + 'static. Update channel type from mpsc::Sender<Bytes> to mpsc::Sender<Arc<P::Output>> for in-process zero-copy mode.

subtasks.title: Add Fan-Out Detection Logic to TransformerNode
subtasks.description: Update TransformerNode::spawn_execution_task to detect when output_channels.len() > 1. For fan-out scenarios, wrap transformed item in Arc::new before sending, and use Arc::clone for each channel send. For single output, use direct move.

subtasks.title: Update TransformerNode Channel Types for Arc
subtasks.description: Change output_channels type in TransformerNode::spawn_execution_task to accept Arc<T::Output> where T::Output: Send + Sync + 'static. Update channel type appropriately for zero-copy fan-out scenarios.

subtasks.title: Handle Arc Unwrapping in ConsumerNode
subtasks.description: Update ConsumerNode::spawn_execution_task to handle Arc-wrapped input items. Use Arc::try_unwrap to extract items when possible (zero-cost if only one reference), or clone if multiple references exist. Update StreamWrapper to handle Arc types.

subtasks.title: Update Message Types to Use Arc
subtasks.description: Review and update message types in packages/message to support Arc for shared ownership. Update MessageMetadata and related types to use Arc where appropriate for zero-copy sharing.

subtasks.title: Review Message Type Structure
subtasks.description: Review packages/message/src/lib.rs to understand current message type structure. Identify fields that can benefit from Arc-based sharing, particularly metadata, headers, and envelope data.

subtasks.title: Add Arc-Based Message Variants
subtasks.description: Add new message type variants or wrapper types that use Arc for shared ownership. Create SharedMessage<T> type that wraps Arc<T> for zero-copy message sharing. Implement necessary conversion methods.

subtasks.title: Update Message Metadata for Arc Support
subtasks.description: Add methods to MessageMetadata (if exists) that support Arc-based metadata sharing. Add with_shared_metadata methods that accept Arc types for zero-copy metadata sharing.

subtasks.title: Implement ZeroCopyShare for Message Types
subtasks.description: Implement ZeroCopyShare trait for message types where appropriate. Ensure message types that support zero-copy sharing implement the trait correctly with Arc<T> as the Shared type.

subtasks.title: Add Arc Pool for High-Performance Scenarios
subtasks.description: Implement optional ArcPool structure for pre-allocated Arc wrappers in high-throughput scenarios. This reduces allocation overhead in hot paths.

subtasks.title: Design ArcPool Structure
subtasks.description: Design ArcPool<T> structure in packages/graph/src/zero_copy.rs that maintains a pool of pre-allocated Arc wrappers. Define methods for getting and returning Arcs from the pool.

subtasks.title: Implement ArcPool Basic Operations
subtasks.description: Implement ArcPool::new, ArcPool::get, and ArcPool::return methods. Use Vec or similar structure to store pooled Arcs. Handle pool exhaustion by allocating new Arcs when pool is empty.

subtasks.title: Add Thread-Safe ArcPool Implementation
subtasks.description: Make ArcPool thread-safe using Arc<Mutex<...>> or similar synchronization primitives. Ensure get and return operations are safe for concurrent access from multiple async tasks.

subtasks.title: Integrate ArcPool into Graph Execution
subtasks.description: Add optional ArcPool parameter to graph execution functions. Allow users to provide an ArcPool for high-performance scenarios. Update fan-out routing to use ArcPool when available.

tasks.title: Task 14: Zero-Copy Architecture Implementation - Phase 3: Conditional Cloning with Cow
tasks.description: Implement Phase 3 of zero-copy architecture: add ZeroCopyTransformer trait, update transformers to support zero-copy with Cow (Clone on Write), and implement conditional cloning patterns.
tasks.details: Phase 3 implements conditional cloning patterns using Cow to avoid unnecessary clones in transformer operations. Transformers that may or may not need to own data can use Cow for zero-copy when possible, cloning only when necessary.

subtasks.title: Implement ZeroCopyTransformer Trait
subtasks.description: Create ZeroCopyTransformer trait in packages/graph/src/zero_copy.rs that extends Transformer trait with zero-copy transform method using Cow. Define transform_zero_copy method that accepts Cow<'a, Input> and returns Cow<'a, Output>.

subtasks.title: Define ZeroCopyTransformer Trait
subtasks.description: Define ZeroCopyTransformer trait that extends Transformer trait. Add transform_zero_copy method with signature: fn transform_zero_copy<'a>(&mut self, input: Cow<'a, Self::Input>) -> Cow<'a, Self::Output>. Add necessary lifetime and trait bounds.

subtasks.title: Add Cow Import and Documentation
subtasks.description: Add use std::borrow::Cow; import to packages/graph/src/zero_copy.rs. Add comprehensive documentation explaining when to use Cow, how it enables zero-copy, and when cloning occurs.

subtasks.title: Export ZeroCopyTransformer from graph Module
subtasks.description: Add pub use zero_copy::ZeroCopyTransformer; to packages/graph/src/lib.rs to export the trait from the graph package.

subtasks.title: Implement ZeroCopyTransformer for MapTransformer
subtasks.description: Implement ZeroCopyTransformer trait for MapTransformer in packages/transformers/src/map/. Add transform_zero_copy implementation that handles Cow::Borrowed and Cow::Owned cases appropriately.

subtasks.title: Add ZeroCopyTransformer Import to MapTransformer
subtasks.description: Add necessary imports to packages/transformers/src/map/transformer.rs including ZeroCopyTransformer trait, Cow, and any required types from graph package.

subtasks.title: Implement transform_zero_copy for MapTransformer
subtasks.description: Implement ZeroCopyTransformer::transform_zero_copy for MapTransformer. Handle Cow::Borrowed by cloning before transformation, handle Cow::Owned by transforming in-place. Return Cow::Owned in both cases since transformation produces new value.

subtasks.title: Update MapTransformer Function Signature
subtasks.description: Review MapTransformer function signature to ensure it's compatible with Cow usage. Update closure type if needed to accept Cow types for zero-copy compatibility.

subtasks.title: Implement InPlaceTransform Trait
subtasks.description: Create InPlaceTransform trait for types that support in-place transformation without allocation. This enables even more efficient zero-copy transformations for mutable types.

subtasks.title: Define InPlaceTransform Trait
subtasks.description: Define InPlaceTransform trait in packages/graph/src/zero_copy.rs with transform_in_place method that takes self by value and returns Self. This allows zero-copy transformation for owned values.

subtasks.title: Define MutateInPlace Trait
subtasks.description: Define MutateInPlace trait for types that can be mutated in-place. Add mutate_in_place method that takes &mut self and applies transformation via closure. This enables zero-allocation in-place mutations.

subtasks.title: Export Traits from graph Module
subtasks.description: Add pub use zero_copy::InPlaceTransform; and pub use zero_copy::MutateInPlace; to packages/graph/src/lib.rs.

subtasks.title: Update Additional Transformers for Zero-Copy
subtasks.description: Update other key transformers to implement ZeroCopyTransformer trait. Focus on high-frequency transformers like FilterTransformer, ReduceTransformer, and other commonly used transformers.

subtasks.title: Implement ZeroCopyTransformer for FilterTransformer
subtasks.description: Implement ZeroCopyTransformer trait for FilterTransformer. Handle Cow::Borrowed and Cow::Owned cases, ensuring filter operations work correctly with borrowed and owned values.

subtasks.title: Implement ZeroCopyTransformer for ReduceTransformer
subtasks.description: Implement ZeroCopyTransformer trait for ReduceTransformer. Handle accumulator state appropriately, ensuring zero-copy when possible while maintaining correct reduction semantics.

subtasks.title: Review and Update Other High-Frequency Transformers
subtasks.description: Review other transformers in packages/transformers/ that are frequently used. Identify which transformers can benefit from ZeroCopyTransformer implementation and implement the trait where appropriate.

subtasks.title: Integrate ZeroCopyTransformer into Graph Execution
subtasks.description: Update graph execution code to use ZeroCopyTransformer when available. Add logic to detect if a transformer implements ZeroCopyTransformer and use transform_zero_copy method instead of regular transform when possible.

subtasks.title: Add ZeroCopyTransformer Detection Logic
subtasks.description: Add helper function or method to detect if a transformer implements ZeroCopyTransformer trait. This may require trait object casting or similar mechanism to check trait implementation.

subtasks.title: Update TransformerNode Execution to Use ZeroCopyTransformer
subtasks.description: Update TransformerNode::spawn_execution_task to check if transformer implements ZeroCopyTransformer. If yes, use transform_zero_copy with Cow::Owned input. If no, fall back to regular transform method.

subtasks.title: Handle Cow Return Values in Execution
subtasks.description: Update graph execution code to handle Cow return values from transform_zero_copy. Extract owned values from Cow::Owned, handle Cow::Borrowed appropriately, and ensure correct ownership transfer to downstream nodes.

tasks.title: Task 15: Zero-Copy Architecture Implementation - Phase 4: Dual-Mode Graph Execution
tasks.description: Implement Phase 4 of zero-copy architecture: add ExecutionMode enum, implement in-process zero-copy execution path, add mode detection logic, and update graph builder API to support dual-mode execution.
tasks.details: Phase 4 implements dual-mode execution where graphs can run in-process (zero-copy) or distributed (serialized) modes. In-process mode eliminates all serialization overhead, achieving 50-80% memory reduction and 30-50% CPU reduction.

subtasks.title: Implement ExecutionMode Enum
subtasks.description: Create ExecutionMode enum in packages/graph/src/execution.rs (or create file if needed) with variants: InProcess, Distributed, and Hybrid. Define all necessary fields and configuration options for each mode.

subtasks.title: Define ExecutionMode Enum Structure
subtasks.description: Define ExecutionMode enum with InProcess { use_shared_memory: bool }, Distributed { serializer: Box<dyn Serializer>, compression: Option<CompressionAlgorithm>, batching: Option<BatchConfig> }, and Hybrid { local_threshold: usize, serializer: Box<dyn Serializer> } variants.

subtasks.title: Define Serializer Trait
subtasks.description: Define Serializer trait in packages/graph/src/serialization.rs with serialize and deserialize methods. This trait abstracts over different serialization formats (JSON, bincode, MessagePack, etc.).

subtasks.title: Define CompressionAlgorithm and BatchConfig Types
subtasks.description: Define CompressionAlgorithm enum (Gzip, Zstd, etc.) and BatchConfig structure (batch_size, batch_timeout, etc.) for distributed execution configuration. Add these types to execution.rs.

subtasks.title: Add ExecutionMode Helper Methods
subtasks.description: Implement ExecutionMode::new_in_process, ExecutionMode::new_in_process_shared_memory, ExecutionMode::new_distributed, and ExecutionMode::new_hybrid constructor methods. Add documentation for each variant.

subtasks.title: Export ExecutionMode from graph Module
subtasks.description: Add pub use execution::ExecutionMode; (or appropriate module path) to packages/graph/src/lib.rs to export ExecutionMode enum.

subtasks.title: Implement In-Process Execution Path
subtasks.description: Implement zero-copy in-process execution path in GraphExecutor that passes data directly without serialization. Use direct stream connections and Arc for fan-out scenarios.

subtasks.title: Create execute_in_process Method
subtasks.description: Create execute_in_process method in GraphExecutor (or Graph struct) that implements zero-copy execution. This method should pass streams directly between nodes without serialization, using Arc for fan-out.

subtasks.title: Implement Direct Stream Passing
subtasks.description: Implement logic to pass streams directly from producer to transformer to consumer without serialization. Use type-safe stream connections, ensuring Input/Output types match between connected nodes.

subtasks.title: Add Arc-Based Fan-Out for In-Process Mode
subtasks.description: Update in-process execution to use Arc for fan-out scenarios. When a node has multiple outputs, wrap items in Arc::new and use Arc::clone for each output channel. This eliminates memory copies in fan-out.

subtasks.title: Handle Fan-In with Stream Merging
subtasks.description: Implement fan-in handling in in-process mode using stream merging. Use futures::stream::select_all or similar to merge multiple input streams into one. Ensure proper ordering and error handling.

subtasks.title: Add Shared Memory Option Support
subtasks.description: Implement optional shared memory support for in-process mode when use_shared_memory is true. This requires additional implementation using shared memory primitives for ultra-high performance scenarios.

subtasks.title: Implement Distributed Execution Path
subtasks.description: Update existing distributed execution path to use ExecutionMode::Distributed configuration. Ensure serialization, compression, and batching options are respected.

subtasks.title: Create execute_distributed Method
subtasks.description: Create execute_distributed method in GraphExecutor that implements serialized execution using the configured Serializer trait. This method should use existing serialization infrastructure with Bytes.

subtasks.title: Integrate Serializer Trait into Execution
subtasks.description: Update distributed execution to use the Serializer trait instead of hardcoded JSON serialization. Call serializer.serialize() and serializer.deserialize() methods appropriately throughout execution.

subtasks.title: Add Compression Support
subtasks.description: Implement compression support for distributed execution when CompressionAlgorithm is specified. Compress serialized data before sending over network, decompress after receiving. Use async-compression crate or similar.

subtasks.title: Add Batching Support
subtasks.description: Implement batching support for distributed execution when BatchConfig is specified. Batch multiple items together before serialization and sending. Handle batch size limits and timeout-based batching.

subtasks.title: Implement Mode Detection and Selection
subtasks.description: Add logic to automatically detect and select execution mode based on graph topology and configuration. Implement hybrid mode that switches between in-process and distributed based on load.

subtasks.title: Implement Automatic Mode Detection
subtasks.description: Add detect_execution_mode method that analyzes graph topology to determine optimal execution mode. Check if all nodes are in same process, if network boundaries exist, and other factors that determine mode selection.

subtasks.title: Implement Hybrid Mode Logic
subtasks.description: Implement hybrid mode execution that starts in in-process mode and switches to distributed mode when local_threshold is exceeded. Monitor throughput and switch modes dynamically based on load.

subtasks.title: Add Mode Selection to Graph Builder
subtasks.description: Update GraphBuilder or Graph::new to accept ExecutionMode parameter. Add with_execution_mode method to builder API. Default to InProcess mode for zero-copy by default.

subtasks.title: Update Graph Builder API
subtasks.description: Update Graph and GraphBuilder APIs to support execution mode configuration. Add methods to set execution mode, serializer, compression, and batching options.

subtasks.title: Add ExecutionMode Field to Graph Struct
subtasks.description: Add mode: ExecutionMode field to Graph struct in packages/graph/src/lib.rs or graph.rs. Initialize with ExecutionMode::InProcess as default in Graph::new().

subtasks.title: Add with_execution_mode Method
subtasks.description: Add with_execution_mode method to Graph builder that sets the execution mode. Return Self for method chaining. Update Graph::run to use the configured execution mode.

subtasks.title: Add with_distributed_execution Helper Method
subtasks.description: Add with_distributed_execution helper method that creates Distributed execution mode with specified serializer. This provides convenient API for users who want distributed execution.

subtasks.title: Update Graph::run to Use ExecutionMode
subtasks.description: Update Graph::run method to match on execution mode and call appropriate execution method (execute_in_process, execute_distributed, or execute_hybrid). Ensure proper error handling and mode-specific logic.

subtasks.title: Implement JSON Serializer for Backward Compatibility
subtasks.description: Implement Serializer trait for JSON serialization to maintain backward compatibility with existing distributed execution. This serves as default serializer.

subtasks.title: Create JsonSerializer Struct
subtasks.description: Create JsonSerializer struct in packages/graph/src/serialization.rs that implements Serializer trait. Use serde_json for serialization/deserialization, returning Bytes.

subtasks.title: Implement Serializer Trait for JsonSerializer
subtasks.description: Implement Serializer::serialize and Serializer::deserialize methods for JsonSerializer. Use existing serde_json serialization logic, converting results to/from Bytes.

subtasks.title: Add JsonSerializer::new Constructor
subtasks.description: Add JsonSerializer::new() constructor method. Export JsonSerializer from graph module for use as default serializer in distributed mode.

tasks.title: Task 16: Zero-Copy Architecture Implementation - Phase 5: String Zero-Copy
tasks.description: Implement Phase 5 of zero-copy architecture: replace String with Arc<str> in message metadata, update string operations, add conversion helpers, and implement string interning for repeated strings.
tasks.details: Phase 5 optimizes string handling by using Arc<str> for shared string data, eliminating string clones in metadata and headers. String interning further reduces memory for repeated strings like topic names and header keys.

subtasks.title: Replace String with Arc<str> in MessageMetadata
subtasks.description: Update MessageMetadata structure in packages/message to use Arc<str> instead of String for source, key, and header fields. This enables zero-copy string sharing.

subtasks.title: Update MessageMetadata Field Types
subtasks.description: Change MessageMetadata fields in packages/message/src/lib.rs: source from Option<String> to Option<Arc<str>>, key from Option<String> to Option<Arc<str>>, and headers from Vec<(String, String)> to Vec<(Arc<str>, Arc<str>)>.

subtasks.title: Add Arc Import to Message Module
subtasks.description: Add use std::sync::Arc; import to packages/message/src/lib.rs. Ensure Arc is available for use in MessageMetadata and related types.

subtasks.title: Update MessageMetadata Constructor Methods
subtasks.description: Update MessageMetadata::new and related constructor methods to work with Arc<str>. Add conversion from String and &str to Arc<str> in constructors. Update with_source, with_key, and header manipulation methods.

subtasks.title: Update MessageMetadata Accessor Methods
subtasks.description: Update MessageMetadata accessor methods (source(), key(), get_header(), etc.) to return &str references using Arc::as_ref(). Ensure all existing API consumers can access string data without changes.

subtasks.title: Add String Conversion Helpers
subtasks.description: Add helper methods and trait implementations for convenient conversion between String, &str, and Arc<str>. Implement Into<Arc<str>> for common string types.

subtasks.title: Implement Into<Arc<str>> for String and &str
subtasks.description: Implement Into<Arc<str>> trait for String and &str types in packages/message/src/lib.rs (or appropriate location). This enables convenient conversion: Arc::from(string) or string.into().

subtasks.title: Add with_source_borrowed Helper Method
subtasks.description: Add MessageMetadata::with_source_borrowed method that accepts &str and converts to Arc<str> using Arc::from. This provides convenient API for borrowed string inputs.

subtasks.title: Add String Conversion Documentation
subtasks.description: Add comprehensive documentation to MessageMetadata methods explaining zero-copy string sharing, when to use Arc<str> vs String, and performance implications. Include examples of string conversion patterns.

subtasks.title: Implement String Interner
subtasks.description: Implement StringInterner structure for zero-copy deduplication of common strings. This reduces memory usage when the same strings appear repeatedly (e.g., topic names, header keys).

subtasks.title: Create StringInterner Structure
subtasks.description: Create StringInterner struct in packages/graph/src/zero_copy.rs (or new file) with internal storage using Arc<RwLock<HashSet<Arc<str>>>>. This stores interned strings for reuse.

subtasks.title: Implement get_or_intern Method
subtasks.description: Implement StringInterner::get_or_intern method that takes &str, checks if string exists in intern set, returns existing Arc<str> if found, or creates new Arc<str> and adds to set if not found. Return cloned Arc<str>.

subtasks.title: Add StringInterner::new Constructor
subtasks.description: Add StringInterner::new() constructor that creates empty intern set. Add capacity hint parameter for pre-allocating space if needed.

subtasks.title: Export StringInterner from graph Module
subtasks.description: Add pub use zero_copy::StringInterner; to packages/graph/src/lib.rs to export StringInterner for use in graph execution and message handling.

subtasks.title: Add Interned String Support to MessageMetadata
subtasks.description: Add with_source_interned and similar methods to MessageMetadata that accept a StringInterner and intern strings before storing. This enables automatic string deduplication.

subtasks.title: Add with_source_interned Method
subtasks.description: Add MessageMetadata::with_source_interned method that accepts &str and &mut StringInterner, interns the string, and stores the interned Arc<str> as source. Return Self for method chaining.

subtasks.title: Add with_key_interned Method
subtasks.description: Add MessageMetadata::with_key_interned method similar to with_source_interned but for key field. Intern key string before storing.

subtasks.title: Add add_header_interned Method
subtasks.description: Add MessageMetadata::add_header_interned method that accepts header key and value &str, interns both strings, and adds interned Arc<str> pair to headers. Return Self for method chaining.

subtasks.title: Add Documentation for Interned Methods
subtasks.description: Add comprehensive documentation explaining when to use interned methods vs regular methods, performance trade-offs, and memory benefits of string interning.

subtasks.title: Update Graph Execution to Use String Interning
subtasks.description: Add optional StringInterner to graph execution context and use it for interning common strings like node names, port names, and message metadata strings.

subtasks.title: Add StringInterner to Graph Execution Context
subtasks.description: Add optional string_interner: Option<StringInterner> field to Graph struct or execution context. Allow users to provide StringInterner for automatic string deduplication.

subtasks.title: Update Node Name Handling to Use Interning
subtasks.description: Update graph execution to intern node names using StringInterner when available. Store interned node names and reuse them throughout execution lifecycle.

subtasks.title: Update Message Metadata Creation to Use Interning
subtasks.description: Update message metadata creation in graph execution to use StringInterner when creating messages. Use interned methods for source, key, and headers when interner is available.

tasks.title: Task 17: Zero-Copy Architecture Implementation - Phase 6: Advanced Zero-Copy
tasks.description: Implement Phase 6 of zero-copy architecture: zero-copy deserialization with lifetime management, optimize error handling with Arc, implement memory pooling for BytesMut, and add CPU cache optimizations.
tasks.details: Phase 6 implements advanced zero-copy optimizations including lifetime-aware deserialization, memory pooling, and CPU cache optimizations. These optimizations further improve performance and memory efficiency.

subtasks.title: Implement Zero-Copy Deserialization with Lifetime Management
subtasks.description: Implement zero-copy deserialization using Bytes with lifetime management. Use serde_json::from_slice with lifetime-aware deserialization for string-heavy data.

subtasks.title: Create ZeroCopyDeserializer Structure
subtasks.description: Create ZeroCopyDeserializer struct in packages/graph/src/serialization.rs that holds Bytes buffer and provides lifetime-aware deserialization. Store buffer as Bytes for shared ownership.

subtasks.title: Implement deserialize Method with Lifetime
subtasks.description: Implement ZeroCopyDeserializer::deserialize method that uses serde_json::from_slice with buffer's lifetime. Use buffer.as_ref() to get &[u8] slice for deserialization. Return deserialized value with appropriate lifetime.

subtasks.title: Add deserialize_zero_copy_strings Function
subtasks.description: Add deserialize_zero_copy_strings function in packages/graph/src/serialization.rs that accepts &[u8] with lifetime and deserializes strings as &str (zero-copy) when data outlives deserialized value. Document lifetime requirements.

subtasks.title: Integrate ZeroCopyDeserializer into Graph Execution
subtasks.description: Update graph execution code to use ZeroCopyDeserializer when deserializing data. Create ZeroCopyDeserializer from received Bytes and use it for deserialization to enable zero-copy string deserialization where possible.

subtasks.title: Optimize Error Handling with Arc
subtasks.description: Update error handling code to use Arc for error context when error rate is significant. This enables zero-copy error context sharing and reduces memory usage in error-heavy scenarios.

subtasks.title: Review Error Types for Arc Opportunities
subtasks.description: Review error types in packages/error/src/error.rs to identify fields that can use Arc for sharing. Focus on StreamError, ErrorContext, and other error types that may be cloned frequently.

subtasks.title: Add Arc-Based Error Context Variants
subtasks.description: Add new error context types or variants that use Arc for shared ownership. Create SharedErrorContext type that wraps Arc<ErrorContext> for zero-copy error context sharing.

subtasks.title: Update Error Creation to Use Arc When Appropriate
subtasks.description: Update error creation code to use Arc when error context is likely to be shared (e.g., in retry scenarios, error propagation). Add logic to detect when Arc should be used based on error handling strategy.

subtasks.title: Add Error Context Conversion Helpers
subtasks.description: Add helper methods to convert between owned and shared error contexts. Implement Into<Arc<ErrorContext>> for ErrorContext and similar conversions for error types.

subtasks.title: Implement Memory Pooling for BytesMut
subtasks.description: Implement memory pooling for BytesMut buffers to reduce allocation overhead. Create BytesPool structure that maintains a pool of reusable BytesMut buffers.

subtasks.title: Create BytesPool Structure
subtasks.description: Create BytesPool struct in packages/graph/src/zero_copy.rs that maintains a pool of BytesMut buffers. Use Vec<BytesMut> or similar structure for pool storage. Add Mutex for thread safety.

subtasks.title: Implement get and return Methods
subtasks.description: Implement BytesPool::get method that returns BytesMut from pool or allocates new one if pool is empty. Implement BytesPool::return method that returns BytesMut to pool after clearing. Handle pool size limits.

subtasks.title: Add Configurable Pool Size
subtasks.description: Add max_pool_size parameter to BytesPool::new to limit pool size and prevent unbounded memory growth. Implement logic to discard excess buffers when pool exceeds max size.

subtasks.title: Integrate BytesPool into Serialization
subtasks.description: Update serialization code to use BytesPool when available. Get BytesMut from pool, use it for serialization, convert to Bytes, and return buffer to pool. Make pool usage optional for backward compatibility.

subtasks.title: Export BytesPool from graph Module
subtasks.description: Add pub use zero_copy::BytesPool; to packages/graph/src/lib.rs to export BytesPool for use in graph execution and serialization.

subtasks.title: Add CPU Cache Optimizations
subtasks.description: Add CPU cache-aware optimizations including structure layout optimization, prefetching hints, and cache-line aware data structures to improve CPU cache efficiency.

subtasks.title: Add Structure Layout Optimizations
subtasks.description: Review hot path data structures and add #[repr(C)] or #[repr(align(N))] attributes where appropriate to optimize memory layout for CPU cache. Focus on frequently accessed structures in graph execution.

subtasks.title: Add Prefetching Hints for Sequential Access
subtasks.description: Add std::intrinsics::prefetch_read_data or similar prefetching hints in hot loops that process data sequentially. Prefetch next items in stream processing loops to improve cache hit rates.

subtasks.title: Optimize Data Structure Alignment
subtasks.description: Review channel buffer sizes and data structure sizes to ensure they align with cache line boundaries (64 bytes). Avoid false sharing by padding structures appropriately. Use #[repr(align(64))] where needed.

subtasks.title: Add Cache-Aware Data Structures
subtasks.description: Review HashMap and Vec usage in hot paths and consider cache-friendly alternatives if available. Ensure data locality is maintained in frequently accessed data structures.

subtasks.title: Add Integration with Custom Allocators
subtasks.description: Add support for custom allocators like jemalloc or mimalloc for predictable performance. Make allocator selection configurable through feature flags.

subtasks.title: Add jemalloc Feature Flag
subtasks.description: Add jemalloc feature flag to packages/graph/Cargo.toml. Add jemallocator dependency as optional dependency with jemalloc feature. Document allocator selection in README.

subtasks.title: Add mimalloc Feature Flag
subtasks.description: Add mimalloc feature flag to packages/graph/Cargo.toml. Add mimalloc dependency as optional dependency with mimalloc feature. Provide alternative to jemalloc.

subtasks.title: Add Allocator Selection Documentation
subtasks.description: Add documentation explaining how to enable custom allocators, performance implications, and when to use jemalloc vs mimalloc vs default allocator. Include feature flag usage examples.
